embed: <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/52wxGESwQSA?version=3&f=videos&app=youtube_gdata"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/52wxGESwQSA?version=3&f=videos&app=youtube_gdata" allowscriptaccess="always" height="344" width="425" allowfullscreen="true" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed></object>
summary:
Exciting information is trapped in web pages and behind HTML forms. In this
tutorial, you'll learn how to parse those pages and when to apply advanced
techniques that make scraping faster and more stable. We'll cover parallel
downloading with Twisted, gevent, and others; analyzing sites behind SSL;
driving JavaScript-y sites with Selenium; and evading common anti-scraping
techniques.
title: Web scraping: Reliably and efficiently pull data from pages that don't expect it
